description: A pink hat with a white X mark and a plume on top. Given to Chopper by Dr. Hiriluk, it becomes Chopper's most treasured possession and iconic trademark throughout the series. The hat symbolizes acceptance, belonging, and Hiriluk's love for Chopper.

ownershipHistory.circumstances: Hiriluk owned the hat before giving it to Chopper
Gift from Hiriluk as a symbol of their bond and Chopper's acceptance

keyMoments.title: Hiriluk Gives Chopper the Hat
keyMoments.description: Hiriluk presents the pink hat to Chopper as a gift, establishing it as a symbol of their relationship.
keyMoments.significance: This moment represents Chopper receiving his first gift and a tangible symbol of acceptance. The hat becomes one of the most recognizable items in One Piece.

symbolism.meaning: Represents acceptance, belonging, and parental love
symbolism.description: The hat is more than an accessory - it's a constant reminder of Hiriluk's acceptance and love. Wearing it helps Chopper feel connected to his father figure and gives him confidence despite being different from others.

culturalSignificance: The pink hat with the X mark becomes Chopper's most iconic visual element throughout the entire One Piece series, appearing in merchandise, promotional materials, and becoming synonymous with the character.
